wordpressPage.title: Conferences
wordpressPage.excerpt: WPCampus currently hosts one in-person and one virtual conference each year. The WPCampus community decided to pivot our 2020 in-person event to an online conference and re-scheduled to convene in...
wordpressPage.content:
WPCampus currently hosts one in-person and one virtual conference each year.

The WPCampus community decided to pivot our 2020 in-person event to an online conference and re-scheduled to convene in New Orleans, Louisiana, for WPCampus 2021. WPCampus 2020 Online will take place July 29-30, 2020. We have re-opened our call for speakers. Read the announcement

Our events

All of the sessions from our events are available in our Learning Library. Visit the website for each event to learn more.

  • WPCampus 2021
    • Dates: Pending
      • We are considering the following dates:
        • July 14-16, 2021 (Wed-Fri)
        • July 21-23, 2021 (Wed-Fri)
        • July 28-30, 2021 (Wed-Fri)
    • Host: Tulane University (New Orleans, Louisiana)
  • WPCampus 2020 Online
    • Dates: July 29-30, 2020
    • Host: Online conference
  • WPCampus 2019
    • Dates: July 25-27, 2019
    • Host: Lewis & Clark College (Portland, Oregon)
  • WPCampus 2019 Online
    • Dates: January 31, 2019
    • Host: Online conference
  • WPCampus 2018
    • Dates: July 12-14, 2018
    • Host: Washington University in St. Louis (St. Louis, Missouri)
  • WPCampus 2018 Online
    • Dates: January 30, 2018
    • Host: Online conference
  • WPCampus 2017
    • Dates: July 14-15, 2017
    • Host: Canisius College (Buffalo, New York)
  • WPCampus 2017 Online
    • Dates: January 23, 2017
    • Host: Online conference
  • WPCampus 2016
    • Dates: July 15-16, 2016
    • Host: University of South Florida Sarasota–Manatee (Sarasota, Florida)

Host universities

Our in-person conferences depend upon the gracious support from universities to host our event and keep the costs low for our attendees.

The following schools have been host universities for WPCampus events:

  • 2021: Tulane University – New Orleans, Louisiana
  • 2019: Lewis & Clark College – Portland, Oregon
  • 2018: Washington University in St. Louis – St. Louis, Missouri
  • 2017: Canisius College – Buffalo, New York
  • 2016: University of South Florida Sarasota–Manatee – Sarasota, Florida

Code of Conduct

WPCampus seeks to provide a friendly, safe environment. All participants should be able to engage in productive dialogue. They should share and learn with each other in an atmosphere of mutual respect. We require all participants to adhere to our code of conduct. This applies to all community interaction and events.

WPCampus events are not WordCamps and are not affiliated with the WordPress Foundation.
